tools.detail: This tool lists words in an HTML document, either uploaded by the user or from a web address. List Words works with relatively small texts of under a megabyte in size. It is part of the TAPoRware collection of tools; there are XML and plain text versions available as well.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: List Words - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: Wordle is an online toy for generating word clouds using the text you provide.  Text can be submitted by providing an URL or by pasting raw text into an input.  The most frequent words from the text are then used as the source for the resulting visualization, where frequency is used to determine the size of each word. You may customize the output by choosing from a variety of display options (layout, font, colours) or use the randomize feature to get a random visualization.  Additionally, there is built-in stop word support for many common languages, and the option to change the word case.
tools.name: Wordle

tools.detail: An application for visualizing a specific collection of authors, and the links or associations between them.  Links are determined by co-occurrence in the Orlando dataset.  The current dataset consists of authors, other people associated with them, and the text entries upon which these associations are based.  The application is designed in such a way that it could be extended to use other datasets as well.The display can be customized in the several ways.  Node colours, shapes and sizes can be altered.  More significantly, the layout of the graph can be chosen from amongst several different algorithms.As the collection is quite large, there are many filtering options available.  In terms of author, the following categories can be specified: gender, author/non-author, and author nationality.  The user can create complex search queries of the authors and the text, and specify a date restriction for the authors' life span.Each association in the text has been tagged with one or more semantic attributes, i.e. the type or meaning of the relation between the people.  These tags have been organized into a tree, moving from general to more specific relations.  Each tag in the tree can be checked/unchecked, further filtering the results.Finally, a data set and customizations can be saved as a session which can then be loaded at a later time.  In addition, screenshots of the current layout can be saved to an image file.
tools.name: OrlandoVision (OVis)

tools.detail: Cirrus is a visualization tool that displays a word cloud relating to the frequency of words appearing in one or more documents. One can click on any word appearing in the cloud to obtain detailed information about its relativity.
tools.name: Voyant Cirrus

tools.detail: Links finds collocates for words and displays links between them using a force directed graph. It shows term frequencies in proximity to keyword. It is a visualization and shows a web of terms.
tools.name: Voyant Links

tools.detail: Bubblelines is a visualization tool that helps to understand patterns of word repetition in one or more documents. Each document is represented as a horizontal line and each seach term is represented as a bubble – the bubble represents the frequency of the term in the corresponding segment of text (the text is divided into segments of equal length).
tools.name: Voyant Bubblelines

tools.detail: Bubbles reads the words in a document (or corpus) and displays the highest frequency words within proportionately large bubbles. Once you arrive to Bubbles, insert / upload your content and let the tool perform its analysis.
tools.name: Voyant Bubbles

tools.detail: Corpus Grid shows an overview of the corpus, including each document's title, number of word tokens (total words), number or word types (unique words), and lexical density (the ratio of tokens to types).
tools.name: Voyant Corpus Grid

tools.detail: Corpus Summary is a tool that provides a simple, textual overview of the current corpus. Features of this tool include number of words, number of unique words, longest documents, highest vocabulary density, most frequent words, notable peaks in frequency, and distinctive words.
tools.name: Voyant Corpus Summary

tools.detail: Corpus Term Frequencies shows overall word frequencies for the entire corpus as well as information about how word frequencies are spread out over documents within the corpus. Hover over column headers and buttons for more information.
tools.name: Voyant Corpus Term Frequencies

tools.detail: Document Term Frequencies shows word frequencies for each document in the corpus. You can see the selected word at the top of the window highlighted in yellow. Its relevance to the documents is shown in the table below.
tools.name: Voyant Document Term Frequencies

tools.detail: Document KWICs shows a table of keywords in their context. In other words, it provides a list of certain keywords and their occurrence within a corpus or document.
tools.name: Voyant Document KWICs

tools.detail: Knots is a visualization tool that helps to understand patterns of word relevance in one or more documents. Each term is represented as a twisted line – when the lines overlap it means a relevance or linkage within the terms.
tools.name: Voyant Knots

tools.detail: Lava allows you to view multiple levels of a corpus in a three-dimensional environment. Clicking on certain documents within the corpus expands the Lava visualization in a ring to explore further.
tools.name: Voyant Lava

tools.detail: Reader acts as a method of reading all documents within a specified corpus. It does not provide text analysis but rather a method of viewing the contents of a corpus.
tools.name: Voyant Reader

tools.detail: ScatterPlot creates a scatter plot graph of terms, spaced by their variation from one another. Once you arrive to ScatterPlot, insert / upload your content and let the tool perform its analysis. You may hover over these dots and click on them for more information.
tools.name: Voyant ScatterPlot

tools.detail: Term Frequencies Chart shows how terms are distributed across document(s) in a corpus (documents are shown in the order in which they were added).
tools.name: Voyant Term Frequencies Chart

tools.detail: Term Fountain is a tool for visualizing word frequencies, and a part of the Voyant suite of tools. It takes the most common words in a corpus and represents them as a fountain. This tool is still in beta.
tools.name: Voyant Term Fountain (beta)

tools.detail: Mandala is a visualization tool that imports “textual” files to perform analysis on the frequency and linkage of words. For example, you may import a play and find the linkage and frequency between a word and its speaker.
tools.name: Voyant Mandala

tools.detail: Orlando contains a relatively large corpus, currently consisting of details about the life and writing careers of roughly 1000 British women writers, amounting to 6.8 million words with 2.2 million semantic tags for everything from paragraphs to politics, plots, or relations with publishers.
tools.name: Orlando Degrees of Separation

tools.detail: Breadboard is an application that allows one to easily find and view authors, with a compact representation of their connections to other authors, places, literary references, organizations and miscellaneous.
tools.name: Orlando Breadboard

tools.detail: Flowerbed is a simple visualization tool for viewing up to two documents. Each document is presented as a “flowerbed”, wherein each word is a flower. The height of the flower is determined by the relative frequency of that word within the document. The petals on each flower represent features associated with the word. When two documents are present in chosen the corpus, the second is mirrored below the first. In this way it is possible to do a cursory comparison of the documents.
tools.name: Voyant Flowerbed (beta)

tools.detail: FeatureClusters is a visualization tool for viewing associations between words, based on commonalities in the feature sets of the words. This is illustrated using a force-directed graph, wherein each word is a node in the graph. Nodes are connected to one another if they share the same feature. Features are represented by the smaller circles (or petals) which surround each word. Moving your mouse over a word will show the feature details associated with that word. Clicking on a word will highlight its connections to other words.
tools.name: Voyant FeatureClusters (beta)

tools.detail: The translate skin is a custom skin for Voyeur Tools which offers multiple translations of the same document. Target languages for the translations are chosen from a comprehensive list and the Google Translate API is used to provide the resulting texts. These are used to populate the final view which consists of a series of Cirrus tools, one for each translation. Further translations can be produced for any of the texts by selecting one from the “Next Translation” drop-down. The Cirrus tools can be arranged in two layouts: tile, and circular. They can also be re-sized and moved to produce a custom layout.
tools.name: Voyant Translate Skin (beta)

tools.detail: This tool lists words in an XML document, either uploaded by the user or from a web address. List Words works with relatively small texts of under a megabyte in size. It is part of the TAPoRware collection of tools; there are HTML and plain text versions available as well.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: List Words - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool lists words in an plain text document, either uploaded by the user or from a web address. List Words works with relatively small texts of under a megabyte in size. It is part of the TAPoRware collection of tools; there are XML and HTML versions available as well. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: List Words - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool lists all tags found in an HTML document, either uploaded by the user or from a web address. It is part of the TAPoRware collection of tools; see List XML Elements for an XML tool with similar functionality.
tools.name: List Tags - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool is used to display the elements and attributes found in an XML document. It enables users to count all instances of an element and to view the structure/hierarchy of the document, in addition to listing attributes and attribute values. It is part of the TAPoRware collection of tools; please see List HTML Tags for a similar HTML tool.
tools.name: List XML Elements (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts text found within specific tags in an HTML document. It is part of the TAPoRware toolset; an XML version is also available. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Extract Text - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts text found within specific tags in an XML document. It is part of the TAPoRware toolset; an HTML version is also available. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Extract Text - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool finds the context for a specified word or pattern anywhere in an HTML document, and can be narrowed to only the text within specified tags. Users may specify the context length, and whether the tool returns the context length in words, sentences, lines or paragraphs. It is also available for XML and plain text documents, and is a part of the TAPoRware toolset. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Concordance - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool finds the context for a specified word or pattern anywhere in an XML document, and can be narrowed to only the text within specified tags. Users may specify the context length, and whether the tool returns the context length in words, sentences, lines or paragraphs. It is also available for HTML and plain text documents, and is a part of the TAPoRware toolset.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Concordance - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool finds the context for a specified word or pattern anywhere in a plain text document. Users may specify the context length, and whether the tool returns the context length in words, sentences, lines or paragraphs. It is also available for XML and HTML documents, and is a part of the TAPoRware toolset. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Concordance - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool looks for two words a certain distance apart from one another in an HTML document, within the user-specified limits of words, sentences or lines. The results can be narrowed to only include words found within certain tags. XML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Co-Occurrence - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool looks for two words a certain distance apart from one another in an XML document, within the user-specified limits of words, sentences or lines. The results can be narrowed to only include words found within certain tags. HTML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Co-Occurrence - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool looks for two words a certain distance apart from one another in a plain text document, within the user-specified limits of words, sentences or lines. The results can be narrowed to only include words found within certain tags. HTML and XML versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Co-Occurrence - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool provides all words directly before and after a user-specified word, based on the desired context of words, lines, sentences or paragraphs. The results can be sorted alphabetically, by frequency, or by Z-score (an indication of how far and in what direction that item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation). XML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Collocation - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool provides all words directly before and after a user-specified word, based on the desired context of words, lines or sentences. The results can be sorted alphabetically, by frequency, or by Z-score (an indication of how far and in what direction that item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation). HTML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Collocation - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool provides all words directly before and after a user-specified word, based on the desired context of words, lines, sentences or paragraphs. The results can be sorted alphabetically, by frequency, or by Z-score (an indication of how far and in what direction that item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation). HTML and XML versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Collocation - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool splits an HTML document at specified points into 'tokens' - words, lines, sentences, paragraphs or characters. The user can specify characters, patterns, or tags upon which to separate tokens, and choose to have the results listed separator removed, appearing before the split, or appearing after the split. Versions are also available for XML and plain text within the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Tokenize - HTML (TAPoR)

tools.detail: This tool splits an XML document at specified points into 'tokens' - words, lines, sentences, paragraphs or characters. The user can specify characters, patterns, or tags upon which to separate tokens, and choose to have the results listed separator removed, appearing before the split, or appearing after the split. Versions are also available for HTML and plain text within the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Tokenize - XML (TAPoR)

tools.detail: This tool splits an HTML document at specified points into 'tokens' - words, lines, sentences, paragraphs or characters. The user can specify characters, patterns, or tags upon which to separate tokens, and choose to have the results listed separator removed, appearing before the split, or appearing after the split. Versions are also available for HTML and plain text within the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Tokenize - Plain Text (TAPoR)

tools.detail: This tool locates fixed phrases of a user-chosen context length containing a specified word and displays all matching phrases in several different ways. Versions are also available for XML and plain text through the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Fixed Phrase - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool locates fixed phrases of a user-chosen context length containing a specified word and displays all matching phrases in several different ways. Versions are also available for HTML and plain text through the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Fixed Phrase - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool locates fixed phrases of a user-chosen context length containing a specified word and displays all matching phrases in several different ways. Versions are also available for HTML and XML through the TAPoR toolset.
tools.name: Fixed Phrase - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts dates from an HTML document from a choice of presets including all dates, years, months, weeks, seasons or North American holidays. Users can also choose to define dates, such as specific month(s), week(s), season(s) or holiday(s). Versions are also available for XML and plain text within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Date Finder - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts dates from an XML document from a choice of presets including all dates, years, months, weeks, seasons or North American holidays. Users can also choose to define dates, such as specific month(s), week(s), season(s) or holiday(s). Versions are also available for HTML and plain text within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Date Finder - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts dates from a plain text document from a choice of presets including all dates, years, months, weeks, seasons or North American holidays. Users can also choose to define dates, such as specific month(s), week(s), season(s) or holiday(s). Versions are also available for HTML and XML within the TAPoRware toolsets.
tools.name: Date Finder - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool creates a summary of statistical information on a given document, and enables the user to select what types of information to display in the summary. The options include high frequency words, sentences with high frequency words, high frequency word context, collocation and element/text distribution. XML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Summarizer - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool creates a summary of statistical information on a given document, and enables the user to select what types of information to display in the summary. The options include high frequency words, sentences with high frequency words, high frequency word context, collocation and element/text distribution. HTML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Summarizer - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool creates a summary of statistical information on a given document, and enables the user to select what types of information to display in the summary. The options include high frequency words, sentences with high frequency words, high frequency word context, collocation and element/text distribution. HTML and XML versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Summarizer - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool creates a graphical distribution list of words found within specific HTML elements. XML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org
tools.name: Distribution Graph - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool creates a graphical distribution list of words found within specific XML elements. HTML and plain text versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org
tools.name: Distribution Graph - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail:
This tool creates a graphical distribution list of words found within the text document. HTML and XML versions are also available within the TAPoRware toolsets.
This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org
tools.name: Distribution Graph - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool compares two documents by comparing the words in each according to user specifications. XML and plain text versions are also available in the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org
tools.name: Comparator - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool compares two documents by comparing the words in each according to user specifications. HTML and plain text versions are also available in the TAPoRware toolsets.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Comparator - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool compares two documents by comparing the words in each according to user specifications. HTML and XML versions are also available in the TAPoRware toolsets. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org
tools.name: Comparator - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts all the URLs, except image sources, in an HTML text. It also converts relative links to clickable absolute links.
tools.name: Link Extractor - HTML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: Tool uses the Hypergraph Package (http://hypergraph.sourceforge.net/) to display the structure of a user-selected XML file. This tool requires jsdk1.4.2 or later; otherwise only the default hypergraph is displayed.
tools.name: Hypergraph - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool performs XML to HTML transformation using an XSL stylesheet. The XSL stylesheet can be from another website or as defined by the user.
tools.name: Transformer - XML (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: The speech tagger allows you to highlight different parts of a text where each part is identified by a different colour. The tool uses TreeTagger to find the different parts of speech. Note that using the TreeTagger tool is very taxing on the server and may take a long time before results are returned.
tools.name: Speech Tagger - Plain Text (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool aggregates texts/subtexts from different locations into a single text. The original texts can be from a user-specified web page or files located on one's computer. Aggregating subtexts requires all documents to share a common subtext tag, such as the <body> tag. The aggregator tool will grab the contents from the texts to form a single new text.
tools.name: Aggregator - Other (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: 'Raining Words' is a tool designed to display word frequency information, minus the words in a chosen stop list, from a user-specified document in a Java applet. High frequency words appear larger and move more slowly than lower frequency words. This tool requires Java 1.4.2_08 or a more recent version for your browser.  As the TAPoRware interface defaults to opening the applet in a new window, popups must also be enabled from the TAPoRware site in order to see the results.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Raining Words - Other (TAPoR)

tools.detail: This tool can find a user-specified string of characters anywhere in a text document. If the string is part of a word or another non-space string, the word or the non-space string will be displayed as a unit. The search can also be used to view a concordance of either words, sentences, or lines surrounding the result. The tool will treat HTML or XML text as plain text.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Raw Grep - Other (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool was designed by the Globalization & Compendium project to tag glossary terms in an XML file, though it can also be used to tag other text formats. Only the first appearance of a term will be tagged.
tools.name: Tagger - Other (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: The Weighted Centroid is a java applet designed to display a circular graph based on word distribution data. The text is divided up into an arbitrary number of units, which are positioned around the circumference of the circle in a clockwise sequence. The more times a word appears in a particular text unit, the closer the word will be to that unit in the circle, and the more units it appears in, the closer it will appera to the centre.
tools.name: Weighted Centroid - Other (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool lists all word pairs found in a document alphabetically, by frequency, by order of appearance, or in reversed alphabetical order. Users may specify restrictions to narrow the results. This tool is currently only available for plain text documents. It will strip all tags from HTML or XML documents and process them as if they were plain text.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: List Word Pairs - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool applies Principal Components Analysis rules to a text to generate relationships between words and text units. It works best with large texts where users can specify units of over 500 words. HTML and XML versions are not currently avaiable.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Principal Components Analysis on Plain Text - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool generates a word cloud of the top frequency words from a text document, with word size determined by its frequency. The user can specify how many words are to be included from the document, whether to apply a modified Glasgow Stop Words list, and the order in which the words are displayed. Clicking on a word in the resultant word cloud will generate a concordance for that word. This tool is currently only available for plain text documents. Should the user provide an HTML or XML text, all tags will be stripped and it will be processed as plain text.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Word Cloud - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts metadata from TEI-compatible XML documents and displays it in name/value format. It is only available for XML.
tools.name: Get TEI Meta Data - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool extracts texts from user-specified HTML tags, elements and attributes. There is no XML counterpart at present.
tools.name: Extract Text From HTML - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool locates acronyms and matches them with the corresponding full name from a user-specified input text.
tools.name: Acronym Finder - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool is a Java applet that allows the user to paint with words extracted from an online document. Java 1.4.2_08 or newer is required.
tools.name: Word Brush - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool finds groups of capital letters (CAPs) in a user-specified plain text file. If the user submits an XML or HTML document, the tool will strip all tags and then process it as plain text. XML and HTML versions are not currently available.
tools.name: CAPs Finder - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool identifies keywords or key phrases within a user-specified text, using the assumption that they will appear with the greatest frequency. It applies a stemmer to every word. Plain text input is recommended. All tags will be stripped from an HTML or XML file submitted, and the resulting document will be processed as if it were plain text. Please note: This tool takes a few minutes to process a given document. This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Keywords Finder - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool compare the text submitted by the user with a predefined control corpus. The tool lists the words common in both texts, in an order set by the user. At present, the tool only offers the Brown Corpus, with more predefined control corpus forthcoming. Users can also upload a text of their own as control corpus.This tool’s functionality has been incorporated into Voyant available online at www.voyant-tools.org.
tools.name: Compare With Control - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: This tool removes all HTML formatting from a web page or an uploaded HTML file, leaving the text for further processing. It is particularly good for preparing text-intensive web pages for analysis as plain text.
tools.name: Web Page Cleaner - Beta (TAPoRware)

tools.detail: Scribe, now in version 3.5, is a free note-taking program available for both PC and Mac. Aimed particularly at historians, this program allows researchers to create digital note cards for managing sources, research notes, contacts, images, glossaries, outlines, timelines and more. Furthermore, it enables organization, keyword indexing, searching, linking and cross-referencing of all entries. Entries can be entered directly or imported from online catalogues such as Amazon.com. Information entered in Scribe can be exported directly to Zotero in addition to assembling, printing or copying formatted bibliographies directly from the program. Articles can be stored directly within the program, enabling researchers to search out and highlight particular words within the text in addition to the relevant researcher notes.
tools.name: CHNM: Scribe

tools.detail: Anthologize is a free, open-source plugin for WordPress 3.0. It enables WordPress to be used as a platform for publishing electronic texts in PDF, ePUB or TEI format. The plugin enables users to grab their existing blog posts, export content from external feeds or compose new content directly in Anthologize, then apply outlining, create a custom order, and edit content into a single document for export. Anthologize requires a self-hosted or local installation of WordPress.
tools.name: Anthologize

tools.detail: Flamenco Search is a downloadable web-based interface from the UC Berkley School of Information based in Python, designed to run on a server. It streamlines the browsing of large collections. It is particularly valuable for items such as documents or images, enabling website visitors to explore content via a hierarchy of categories and subcategories called facets. Users can assign keywords and metadata which is then used to guide site visitors to the choices that best meet their interests, while allowing them to refine or expand their query and remain oriented in relation to the rest of the collection.
tools.name: Flamenco Search

tools.detail: Commentpress is an open source theme and plugin for Wordpress 3.3.1 or later designed to enable readers to contribute comments to each paragraph of a text and display those comments in the margins. Commentpress turns a text into a conversation, whether a blog or a fixed document such as an essay, book or article. It may also be used to add a gloss or annotations to a document. This tool is also available for BuddyPress and BP Group Blog.
tools.name: Commentpress

tools.detail: The Text-Image Linking Environment (TILE) is a web-based tool that enables users to select regions of an image and link them to text. TILE is a system for creating and editing image-based electronic editions and connecting them to digital archives of the texts. It has been designed for easy modification by integrating a plugin infrastructure.
tools.name: TILE (Text Image Linking Environment)

tools.detail: MONK (Metadata Offer New Knowledge) is a digital environment for humanities scholars. It is desgined to assist with the discovery and analysis of patterns within texts, incorporating full text content from corpora such as ECCO, EEBO and Early American Fiction directly into the tool. The MONK Workbench is the primary environment, permitting users to create worksets, perform analytics and save their results. In addition, the MONK workbench can be used in conjunction with the Flameco faceted browser and Zotero.
tools.name: MONK (Metadata Offer New Knowledge)

tools.detail: MorphAdorner, now in version 2.0, is a Java command-line program for the adornment of words in a text. At present, available adornments include standard spellings, parts of speech and lemmata, in addition to tokenization, the recognition of sentence boundaries and extracting names and places. Version 2.0 features a separate MorphAdorner Server, an improved integration with MONK's Abbot and improved processing of the Early English Books Online (EEBO), Eighteenth Century Collections Online (ECCO) and Evans Early American Imprint Collection corpori.
tools.name: MorphAdorner

tools.detail: NLTK 2.0 (Natural Language Tooklt) is a free, open source collection of Python modules, linguistic data and documentation for research and development in natural language processing and text analytics, with distributions for Windows, Mac OS X and Linux. It offers a platform for building Python programs to work with human language data, and integrates a guide to programming fundamentals.
tools.name: NLTK 3.3 (Natural Language Toolkit)

tools.detail: WordHoard is a tool for the study of large texts or transcribed speech. It annotates or tags texts by applying morphological, lexical, prosodic, and narratological criteria. Users may apply WordHoard to their own texts, or to the corpora included with the tool. At present, that corpora includes the entire canon of Early Greek epic (original and in translation), Chaucer, Shakespeare and Spencer.
tools.name: WordHoard

tools.detail: PhiloGL is an open source WebGL Framework for advanced data visualization, creative coding and game development. It includes a module system encompassing Program and Shader management, IO, XHR, JSONP, Web Worker management, Effects and Tweening, among others.
tools.name: PhiloGL

tools.detail: RiTa is a free, open-source natural language library for work with generative literature, offered as both a 'core' package of jar files and documentation, and a text-to-speech package. It is designed to be simple and intuitive while still offering flexibility to advanced users via statistical models for tagging, chunking and parsing. RiTa may also be integrated with Processing.
tools.name: RiTa

tools.detail: RoSE is a web-based system blending social computing with humanities bibliographical resources, enabling these resources to be explored as a social network. It incorporates data mined from YAGO and Project Gutenberg, offers profile pages for both persons and documents, keywords, and visualizations of the relationships between people and documents. Users are encouraged to contribute metadata supplementing the standard bibliographical data.
tools.name: RoSE

tools.detail: Scripto is a lightweight, open source tool for crowdsourcing transcriptions for Humanities projects. Projects utilizing Scripto can manage contributions via full editorial controls and a versioning history.
tools.name: Scripto

tools.detail: Citeline was a tool for publishing bibliographies and citation collections on the web. It takes a BibTex file exported from Endnotes, Refworks and similar tools and turns the collection into an interactive, shareable exhibit. Citeline citation collections may also be exported in a variety of formats, such as BibTex, JSON, XML or tab-separated values. The Citeline project has been retired, and the website is no longer available. Information about Citeline is currently only available via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Citeline

tools.detail: Exhibit 3.0, a part of the SIMILE Widgets family of tools, is an open source software tool for web-based data publishing. This JavaScript-based browser widget facilitates searching, browsing, navigating and visualization data, and enables users to publish their data collections as websites without requiring programming, a database or access to a server.
tools.name: SIMILE Widgets: Exhibit 3.0

tools.detail: Gadget, a part of the SIMILE Widgets family of tools, is an open source command line XML inspector for generating useful summaries from large amounts of well-formed XML data. It is particularly valuable when exploring, migrating or cleaning XML, in addition to evaluating schema emergence. This tool require a Java 1.4 or later compatible virtual machine and Maven 2.0 or above to run. Gadget is no longer maintained, but information about it is still available via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SIMILE Widgets: Gadget

tools.detail: JsTeX, a part of the SIMILE Widgets family of tools, is an open source JavaScript library capable of interpreting basic TeX encodings and transforming them into HTML definitions directly in a web page. This tool has been retired by SIMILE Widgets, and the website is no longer maintained. Captures of the site are currently available via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SIMILE Widgets: JsTeX

tools.detail: Timeline, a part of the SIMILE Widgets family of tools, is a free, open source tool for creating interactive timelines from temporal data utilizing JavaScript and web markup in HTML and XML.
tools.name: SIMILE Widgets: Timeline

tools.detail: TimePlot, a part of the SIMILE Widgets family of tools, is a free, open source DHTML-based AJAXy widget for plotting time series and overlaying time-based events over them. The overlays use the same data formats supported by the related SIMILE Widgets Timeline tool. Timeplots are generated with a combination of JavaScript and HTML.
tools.name: SIMILE Widgets: Timeplot

tools.detail: Stanford CoreNLP is a free Natural Language Processing tool. It processes English language text and provides the base forms of words, parts of speech, indicates whether they are proper names, normalizes dates, times and numeric quantities, and marks up the structure of sentences. This tool integrates all other Stanford NLP tools for English language processing, including parts-of-speech (POS), the named entitiy recognizer (NER), the parser and the coreference resolution system. An online demo is also available.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: CoreNLP

tools.detail: Stanford Named Entity Recognizer is a free Java implementation for the recognition of proper names and other nouns and a part of the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. It also includes person, location and organizational recognition. This tool can be used with English or German text.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Named Entity Recognizer

tools.detail: Stanford Part-of-Speech Tagger is a free Java implementation for the recognition of parts of speech, and a part of the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. It reads text and assigns parts of speech to each word such as noun, verb or adjective. This tool can be used with English, French, Arabic and German text.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Part-of-Speech Tagger

tools.detail: Stanford Parser is a free Java implementation for the statistical parsing of text, and a part of the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. This tool can be used with English, Chinese, German and Arabic. A demo web browser version is also available.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Parser

tools.detail: Stanford Phrasal is a a free Java implementation for phrase-based machine translation. It provides an easy to use API for implementating new decoding model features and supports unique capabilities such as translating using phrases that include gaps and conditional extraction of phrase-tables and lexical reordering models.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Phrasal

tools.detail: Stanford Tokenizer is a free Java implementation for diving an English text into tokens such as words, and a part of the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. This tool is not available on its own, but is bundled with other tools in the same set, including Stanford Parser, Stanford Part-of-Speech Tagger, Stanford Named Entity Recognizer, and Stanford CoreNLP.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Tokenizer

tools.detail: Stanford Topic Modelling Toolbox is a free collection of topic modelling tools, and a part of the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. It is designed for social scientists and other users who need to analyze datasets with a substantial textual component. This tool can accept and generate tab-separated and comma-separated values, and is designed to work in combination with spreadsheet programs like Excel.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Topic Modelling Toolbox

tools.detail: Stanford Tregex and Tsurgeon is a bundled pair of tools from the Stanford Natural Language Processing toolset. Tregex is a utility for using tree relationships and regular expressions to match patterns in trees, while Tsurgeon is a tree transformation language.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Tregex and Tsurgeon

tools.detail: D3.js is a free, open source JavaScript library for manipulating documents with data utilizing HTML5, SVG and CSS3. It is designed to create visualizations that work with current web standards to make the best possible use of the most recent browsers without requiring a proprietary framework. This tool allows users to bind data to an Document Object Model (DOM) and apply data-driven transformations to the document.
tools.name: d3.js - Data Driven Documents

tools.detail: Data Wrangler is free web-based tool for interactive data cleaning and transformation. It takes raw data and transforms it into data tables for further analysis and cleaning. The results can be exported in a variety of data table formats, including Excel, R, Tableau and Protovis.
tools.name: Stanford Vis Group: Data Wrangler

tools.detail: Protovis is a free, open source tool for composing custom views of data from simple elements such as bars or dots. Marks are defined through dynamic properties to allow inheritance, scales and layouts for simplified visualization construction. This tool uses JavaScript and SVG in order to ensure web-native visualizations. Protovis is no longer under active construction; many of the concepts used in its development have been implemented in its successor, D3.js.
tools.name: Stanford Vis Group: Protovis

tools.detail: TagCrowd is a tool for generating a frequency-based word cloud from a source text, with a free browser version available through the TagCrowd website. A commercial version may also be purchased, subject to a creative commons license.
tools.name: TagCrowd

tools.detail: TextArc is a free visualization tool that represents an entire text on a single page. It has elements of an index, concordance and summary all in one place, encouraging the viewer to use its juxtapositions to uncover meaning. The web-based applet is preloaded with thousands of text collected from Project Gutenberg. Note: TextArc was designed for browsers circa 2002 and requires Java SE 6 to run.
tools.name: TextArc

tools.detail: FeatureLens is a free tool for visualizing and exploring patterns in text collections. This tool integrates the results of text-mining algorithms, and can assist in finding frequent words or ngrams, enabling the discovery of fuzzy repetition patterns. In addition, the tool will recommend features based on particular pattern types identified in the text.
tools.name: University of Maryland HCI Group: FeatureLens

tools.detail: The Versioning Machine, now in version 4.0, is a framework and an interface for displaying multiple versions of text, and encodes the text according to TEI guidelines. It incorporates features found in both critical editions and electronic publication, in addition to providing an environment for textual editors to comparatively view the results of their edits. This tool may be downloaded for use on a local machine, or hosted on one's server for web usage.
tools.name: Versioning Machine

tools.detail: WordSmith Tools is a commercial integrated suite of programs designed to analyze word behaviour in a text. It can be used to generate a list of all words or word clusters, concord, find keywords and more. This tool is recommended for publishers, language teachers and students, and language researchers.
tools.name: WordSmith

tools.detail: Apache OpenNLP is a free, open source toolkit for processing natural language text, based on machine learning. It includes common natural language processing functions such as tokenization, sentence segmentation, part-of-speech tagging, named entity extraction, chunking, parsing, and coreference resolution.
tools.name: Apache Open NLP

tools.detail: Apache UIMA (Unstructured Information Management application) is a software system for analyzing large amounts of unstructured data, such as a plain text document, and identifying entities, such as persons, places, organizations, or relations between entities. Discrete components (written in Java or C++) may be used within the application, such as language identification or entitiy detection. Each component provides self-describing metadata via XML descriptor files.
tools.name: Apache UIMA

tools.detail: Cytoscape is an open source software platform for visualizing data networks and pathways. Though designed for bioinformatic systems, it has been generalized to complex network analysis and has applications extending to the semantic web. Its core distribution has basic features for data integration and visualization, with additional features available via Java-based plugins.
tools.name: Cytoscape

tools.detail: DocuBurst is a free web-based visualization tool for exploring the contents of a text.  Visitors can upload their own text or view those provided by others. DocuBurst presents an interactive chart called a ‘radial sunburst’ diagram which organizes the nouns extracted from the user-supplied text based on their meaning, and colours them based on frequency, revealing common themes in the text.  The visualization also shows the proper nouns (e.g. character names) in a linked word cloud. The visualization may be zoomed, filtered, or refocused to target types of words of interest (e.g. “animal” words or “feeling” words).  The visualization also provides a comparison tool to contrast word use across two documents.  DocuBurst views can be bookmarked, annotated, shared, and embedded in your own website.
tools.name: DocuBurst

tools.detail: Comparison Arcs is a free proof of concept tool demonstrating a method for comparing the linguistic properties of multiple documents in graphical displays. Both texts may be searched in parallel for words, lemmas and parts of speech. This project is seeking partners for further development.
tools.name: EURAC: Comparison Arcs

tools.detail: Corpus Clouds is a free Java demo of a novel interface to a corpus query engine. It aims to aid the user in exploratory search by providing visual information about frequency and distribution of search results in combination with the standard KWIC elements.
tools.name: EURAC: Corpus Clouds

tools.detail: Double Tree is a free, open source Java application providing a visualization component for supporting exploratory corpus analysis. It focuses particularly on analyzing concordances, and can also represent a KWIC for a single word by collapsing the contexts into a double sided tree. Each side of the tree can be expanded independently to browse the results.
tools.name: EURAC: Double Tree

tools.detail: End to End is a visualization application for exploratory corpus analysis focused on collocations. This tool starts with two words and constructs a visual network of all collocations of those words within the corpus, while its interface enables interactive zooming and browsing of the resultant graph. Note: this tool is unavailable until licensing issues are resolved.
tools.name: EURAC: End to End

tools.detail: The JavaScript InfoVis Toolkit is a free set of tools for creating interactive data visualizations compatible with web standards. Visualization options include bar graphs, radial graphs, tree graphs and more, many integrating animations.
tools.name: JavaScript InfoVis Toolkit

tools.detail: Letter-Pairs Analysis is a free, web-based tool for calculating and visualizing the number of times a pair of letters appears in a given text. Each pair is represented as a 'bubble', sized according to how frequently that pair appears in the text. An HTML5 version is also now available. Note: this tool forms the basis of Voyant Bubbles.
tools.name: Letter-Pairs Analysis

tools.detail: Processing is a free, open source programming language and development library for the visual arts. It is a software sketchbook, a way to visually learn programming fundamentals, and a tool for creating finished professional work, including mapping networks, textual analysis and producing visualizations. It runs under Windows, OSX and Linux environments, and can export graphics and applets in a variety of formats.
tools.name: Processing

tools.detail: RapidMiner is an open source data mining tool with a GUI interface, available in both a free, unsupported 'community version' and a for-pay, fully supported 'enterprise edition'. It utilizes a standardized XML interchange format for processing, and is compatible with common relational databases and spreadsheet applications.
tools.name: RapidMiner

tools.detail: SEASR's OpenNLP Entities to Protovis Network Graph is a free tool for extracting entities within a specified sentence distance within a text. The OpenNLP system is used for entity extraction, and their relationships are represented in a link node network graph generated in Protovis.  While SEASR is still active, their page for OpenNLP Entities to Protivis Network Graph is no longer available. It can still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SEASR: OpenNLP Entities To Protovis Network Graph

tools.detail: SEASR's Date Entities to Similie Timeline is a free tool for extracting data entities that may be displayed on a timeline. It uses OpenNLP to extract sentences containing dates, and SIMILE Timeline to display them.
tools.name: SEASR: Date Entities to Simile Timeline

tools.detail: SEASR's Flesch-Kinkaid Readability Test is a free tool that analyses text from a URL, calculates the Flesch-Kincaid readibility measure of the text, and displays the results.
tools.name: SEASR: Flesch-Kincaid Readability Test

tools.detail: SEASR's Google Search To Entities To Protovis Network Graph is a free tool for submitting a search to Google and returning a specified number of documents for further processing. It then analyses the documents for connections within a specified number of sentences, and generates a link node network graph using Protovis from the results. SEASR's page for Google Search To Entities To Protovis Network Graph is no longer available. Information about the tool can still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SEASR: Google Search To Entities To Protovis Network Graph

tools.detail: SEASR's Location Entities To Google Map is a tool for extracting locations from a text that can be displayed on a map. It uses OpenNLP to extract the entities, and then displays both the sentences and the locations in Google Maps. The page for this tool on SEASR's website is no longer active. However, it can still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SEASR: Location Entities To Google Map

tools.detail: SEASR's NGram Tag Cloud Viewer is a free tool for generating a tag cloud from a text hosted at a URL. It can also process PDF documents. Although the page on SEASR's website is no longer active, it can still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SEASR: NGram Tag Cloud Viewer

tools.detail: SEASR's Tag Cloud Viewer With Stemming is a free tool for creating a tag cloud from a text hosted at a URL, and can process PDF documents. While this tool is similar to SEASR's NGram Tag Cloud Viewer, it applies a stemmer to the text during processing. Though the page for this tool is no longer available on the SEASR website, it can still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: SEASR: Tag Cloud Viewer With Stemming

tools.detail: PaperToolkit is a free, open source toolkit for designing pen and paper applications. Applications generated with this tool are intended for printing on a paper surface that allows some digital interaction, such as the related ButterflyNet or Interactive Gigapixels Prints. Suggested applications include interactive newspapers and smart notebooks. This toolkit is currently under development; code, documentation, tutorials and demo applications are all available.
tools.name: Stanford HCI Group: PaperToolkit

tools.detail: Muse is a free, open source JavaScript tool for reflecting on and searching for patterns in the past by examining one's personal e-mail archive. It analyses e-mail to generate several views including a sentiment graph from messages that may reflect particular emotions or feelings, inferred groups based on communications with various contacts, a calendar view, or an an attachment wall of all documents attached to e-mails.
tools.name: Stanford Mobisocial Lab: Muse

tools.detail: Gigapixel is a free tool to facilitate experiments in collaborate workspaces, enabling printed visualizations to be augmented with projectors and mobile devices. This tool has been succeeded by PaperToolKit, and continues to be available as a reference resource.
tools.name: Stanford HCI Group: Gigapixel

tools.detail: Stanford Word Segmenter is a free, open source Java-based tokenization tool for Chinese and Arabic text that integrates token pre-processing, or segmentation. For Arabic, the tool processes text according to the Penn Arabic Treebank 3 standard. For Chinese, users can choose between the Chinese Penn Treebank or Peking University standards.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Stanford Word Segmenter

tools.detail: Stanford Classifier is a free, open source Java-based machine learning tool that takes data and applies probibalistic classification. It can also give probability distribution information related to class assignments.
tools.name: Stanford NLP Group: Classifier

tools.detail: CommentSpace is a free, collaborative tool for analysis of comments and visualizations on a website. It uses tags and links to organize the findings and identify contributions from particular users. This tool can assist analysts in identifying evidence and establishing common ground, and can help teams in evidence-gathering and synthesis tasks.
tools.name: CommentSpace

tools.detail: GeoTime is a tool for visualizing complex event-related data available for purchase. It can simultaneously visualize geospatial, temporal and link data to display activities and events. Data can be imported from ArcGIS or Microsoft Excel.
tools.name: GeoTime

tools.detail: Graphviz is a free, open source graph visualization tool in constant development since 1988. It represents structural information as diagrams of abstract graphs and networks.
tools.name: Graphviz

tools.detail: AntCLAWS-GUI is a free graphical user interface intended for use with the Lancaster University CLAWS parts of speech tagger. This GUI requires installation of CLAWS to operate.
tools.name: Laurence Anthony: AntCLAWS-GUI

tools.detail:
AntConc is free concordance software. It is multi-platform and easy to deploy and use.

AntConc is part of a suite of related tools for text processing and analysis, including applications for parallel corpus analysis, word profiling, PDF to text conversion, text structure analysis, detecting and converting character encodings, Japanese and Chinese segmenter and tokenizer, wordclass tagger, and spelling variant anaysis. The developer is currently drafting a more explicit licence for the use of the software.
tools.name: AntConc

tools.detail: AntWordProfiler is a free tool for word profiling. For each word in a document, it will generate the base form and a list of possible related words, provide statistics and frequency data and list word types. It can also process files separately or as a batch.
tools.name: Laurence Anthony: AntWordProfiler

tools.detail: CLAWS (Constituent Likelihood Automatic Word-tagging System) is a free parts-of-speech tagging tool from Lancaster University. It has been continuously developed since the 1980s, has consistently achieved 96-97% accuracy, and has been applied to the over 100 million word British National Corpus. This tool is available for download in addition to an on-line 'trial' version.
tools.name: CLAWS Part-of-Speech Tagger

tools.detail: Timeline Builder is a free tool for creating and maintaining interactive, Flash-based timelines for viewing on the web. Basic text formatting and links to other resources can be added through basic HTML. This tool requires registration through the web page.
tools.name: CHNM: Timeline Builder (Beta)

tools.detail: Many Eyes is a free collection of data visualization tools enabling exploration and discussion of the data. Users who post comments on a visualization may also save their view for others to see in conjunction with their comment. Visualizations can be created from the data sets loaded into the site, or one can upload a new dataset for use. Note: Uploaded datasets are shared with the site.
tools.name: IBM: Many Eyes

tools.detail: Dynamic Table of Contexts is a free tool for supplementing a traditional table of contents for a text. It allows users to add or subtract index items based on XML encoding. This tool requires the creation of an account.
tools.name: INKE: Dynamic Table of Contexts

tools.detail: Mandala Browser is a rich-prospect browsing interface for exploring a data set in .txt, .rft, .pdf, .csv or .xml format. Searches can be constrained by columns or fields. A version of this tool is also available in the Voyant toolset.
tools.name: Mandala Browser

tools.detail: Voyant Skin Builder is a function within the larger Voyant toolset that enables users to create a customized selection and arrangement of tools with which to analyze a text. These custom skins can be saved or exported for future use.
tools.name: Voyant Skin Builder

tools.detail: Words in Context, from the Visualizing Literature toolset, allows users to select a text from Visualizing Literature's list of grade school curriculum exemplar creative commons texts and perform a keyword search. The results of the search show all instances of the word, with all surrounding text found on the same line for context. All texts are searchable, and can be sorted by writer, title, publication year, grade level, availability for analysis and availablility of a direct link to the text. Please note that, as this toolset is still in beta, the selection of texts is currently limited, though over 300 texts are forthcoming. As of 2014, this toolset is no longer available as the website has been taken down. It may still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Visualizing Literature: Words in Context

tools.detail: Sentiment, from the Visualizing Literature toolset, allows users to select a text from Visualizing Literature's list of grade school curriculum exemplar creative commons texts and graph it for keywords suggestive of sentiment. All texts are searchable, and can be sorted by writer, title, publication year, grade level, availability for analysis and availablility of a direct link to the text. Please note that, as this toolset is still in beta, the selection of texts is currently limited, though over 300 texts are forthcoming. As of 2014, this toolset is no longer available as the website has been taken down. It may still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Visualizing Literature: Sentiment

tools.detail: Virtue and Vice, from the Visualizing Literature toolset, allows users to select a text from Visualizing Literature's list of grade school curriculum exemplar creative commons texts and graph out all instances of words suggestive of virtue and vice within the text. All texts are searchable, and can be sorted by writer, title, publication year, grade level, availability for analysis and availablility of a direct link to the text. Please note that, as this toolset is still in beta, the selection of texts is currently limited, though over 300 texts are forthcoming. As of 2014, this toolset is no longer available as the website has been taken down. It may still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Visualizing Literature: Virtue and Vice

tools.detail: Adjectives in the Book, from the Visualizing Literature toolset, allows users to select a text from Visualizing Literature's list of grade school curriculum exemplar creative commons texts and visualize the most common adjectives within the text. Users can search the whole text or chapter by chapter, and incude or exclude stopwords in the results. All texts are searchable, and can be sorted by writer, title, publication year, grade level, availability for analysis and availablility of a direct link to the text. Please note that, as this toolset is still in beta, the selection of texts is currently limited, though over 300 texts are forthcoming. As of 2014, this toolset is no longer available as the website has been taken down. It may still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Visualizing Literature: Adjectives in the Book

tools.detail: Adjectives and Character (Treemap), from the Visualizing Literature toolset, allows users to select a text from Visualizing Literature's list of grade school curriculum exemplar creative commons texts and search for a character name from the text. The results visualize the most common adjectives associated with that character, and may include or exclude stopwords. All texts are searchable, and can be sorted by writer, title, publication year, grade level, availability for analysis and availablility of a direct link to the text. Please note that, as this toolset is still in beta, the selection of texts is currently limited, though over 300 texts are forthcoming. As of 2014, this toolset is no longer available as the website has been taken down. It may still be viewed via the Internet Archive.
tools.name: Visualizing Literature: Adjectives and Character (Treemap)

tools.detail: This prototype was produced as a proof-of-concept for the Criminal Intent project.  It allows the records of the Old Bailey Online project to be searched such that the returned results can be viewed as either a timeline or a concordance of terms.  The tool allows for reasonably complex queries to be placed and a range of different formats for the returned charts to be selected.  The tool is primarily built with Python and SQLite and makes use of the Google Chart API for some output options.
tools.name: Old Bailey Data Warehousing Interface

tools.detail: I Write Like is a free, web-based text analysis tool that compares a user-provided text to the prose of well-known writers using statistics, word choice and writing style analysis. It then reports on which writer the text most resembles. The tool requires at least two paragraphs of text for best results. At this time, the results are limited to the name of a writer, without offering more detailed insight into the analysis; the tool appears to be offered primarily to promote the Memoires journaling software.
tools.name: I Write Like

tools.detail: Bookworm is a free tool from the Harvard Cultural Observatory designed to generate data from searches on the Open Library and Internet Archives' collections of public domain books. It allows users to search keywords, including in multiple languages simultaneously, and narrow terms by country, gender, subject and header. At present, Bookworm is restricted to searching books published between 1820 and 1920 due to availabliity. The tool produces a graph showing instances of each keyword over time, enabling easy comparison of results.
tools.name: Bookworm

tools.detail: The brat rapid annotation tool is an online environment for collaborative structured annotation of texts. It can be run in a browser (optimized for Chrome and Safari) or downloaded for local installation. It can be used for a variety of annotation tasks, from identitifying natural language entities to chunking to adding metadata.
tools.name: brat rapid annotation tool

tools.detail: CATMA (Computer Aided Textual Markup and Analysis) is a free, open source markup and analysis tool from the University of Hamburg's Department of Languages, Literature and Media. It incorporates three interactive modules, a tagger enabling textual markup and markup editing, an analyzer incorporating a query language and predefined functions, and a query builder that allows users to construct queries from combinations of pre-defined questions while allowing for manual modification for more specific questions. It also interfaces with the Voyant toolset. As of version 4.1, CATMA is a web application with collaborative work functions, and improvements to its user interface, queries and corpus analysis capacity.
tools.name: CATMA (Computer Aided Textual Markup and Analysis)

tools.detail: Edit Flow is a free, open source WordPress plugin designed for editorial collaboration. It includes a private discussion environment, metadata management and workflow tools.
tools.name: Edit Flow

tools.detail: Philologic is a free, open source full-text search, retrieval and analysis tool developed by the ARTFL Project and the Digital Library Development Centre, at the University of Chicago. This tool supports a wide variety of XML and SGML encoded documents, in addition to plain text, Dublin Core and HTML, and includes a MySQL back end. It is designed ot be light, fast and robust, boasts extensive use and testing, and can be used directly 'out of the box' with numerous configuration options built in.
tools.name: PhiloLogic

tools.detail: FromThePage is a free software for manuscript transcription, allowing volunteers to transcribe document pages online. Transcriptions can then be marked up and annotated in a wiki-like enviroment, with the resultant text displayed on the public web. It includes a discussion environment, enabling collaboration on particularly difficult pages. FromThePage is currently in beta, permitting up to 100 pages per project, and is in the process of developing a paid version for larger projects requiring more server space, with price determined primarily by server and maintenance costs. Privacy features are also under development, and further features forthcoming based on feedback from users.
tools.name: FromThePage

tools.detail: GapVis is a free tool developed in conjunction with Google Ancient Places to visualize the locations within and allow the exploration of books referencing ancient places within the Google Books collection. Users can view text summaries, use an enhanced reading interface and explore the location references through a place detail view. It is intended both to enable location-based text discovery, and to allow users to delve more deeply into a text based on the locations referenced within it. GapVis is currently in beta.
tools.name: GapVis

tools.detail: Pundit is a free, creative commons tool developed by the SemLib Project for creating structured annotations of web pages. These annotations can be collected in virtual notebooks and shared to create collaborative structured data. Annotations may be comments, links, citations and cross-references. Fine granular image annotation and text-to-text annotation are forthcoming.
tools.name: Pundit

tools.detail: Gephi is a free, open source interactive visualization and data exploration tool. Users can manipulate the display to uncover new facets of the data, enabling intutive exploration.
tools.name: Gephi

tools.detail: Juxta is a free, open source tool for comparing and collating texts, originally intended for comparing multiple versions of the same text. It offers several views and visualization options, including histograms and side by side comparison. Juxta is available as both a desktop application and as a web service that can be integrated into the user's own website.
tools.name: Juxta

tools.detail: Orange is a free, open source data visualization and analysis tool. It allows users to conduct data mining either through its visual programming language, or via Python scripts, and includes components for machine learning. Orange includes both add-ons for biometrics and text mining, and data analytic features.
tools.name: Orange

tools.detail: ORBIS: Stanford Geospatial Network Model of the Roman World is a tool and academic resource for reconstructing the time and financial costs of travel in the ancient world. Its model is based on a simplified network of Roman cities, roads, rivers and sea lanes, and takes into account such factors as time of year and method of travel. Users can enter parameters to generate models and interactive maps.
tools.name: ORBIS: Stanford Geospatial Network Model of the Roman World

tools.detail: Sophie is a free, creative commons authoring tool from the Institute for the Future of the Book and the University of Southern California's School of Cinematic Arts that enables collaboration, reading and publication. Its highlights include an authoring environment that allows users to create complex networked multimedia documents, a reader than opens books in a browser without downloading additional software, comment frames for adding discussions within books, digital libraries compatible with the Sophe iPad app, timeline creation and collaborative book creation. As of version 2.1, Sophie includes HTML5 export for data integrating multimedia content and for use on a wide variety of devices.
tools.name: Sophie

tools.detail: T-PEN is a free toolset from the Center for Digital Theology at Saint Louis University for working with images of manuscripts and attaching transcription data. It has features for collaborative transcription in XML, multiple data viewing, data manipulation and data export. T-PEN includes support for multiple languages with French, Middle English and Old English dictionaries. User accounts are available by request.
tools.name: T-PEN

tools.detail: Textalyser is a free web-based text analysis tool offered by the Bernhard Huber Internet Engineering Company. Users can paste text into the provided entry field, upload a file or provide a URL for analysis. Textalyser provides detailed statistics on the text to determine subject, analyse word groupings, determine keyword density and deterimine the most prominent phrase. The Textalyser website is no longer available as of late 2014. It has been captured by the Internet Archive, and can still be viewed there.
tools.name: Textalyser

tools.detail: TextSTAT is a free text analysis tool offered by Niederländische Philologie, FU Berlin. It is a simple program designed to accept plain text, HTML, Word and OpenOffice files to produce word frequency lists and concordances, and versions are available in English, German, Dutch, Portugese, Spanish, French, Italian, Galician, Finnish, Polish and Czech. TextSTAT also includes a web spider and news reader for adding web pages and news to a corpus.
tools.name: TextSTAT

tools.detail: TokenX is a free text visualization and analysis tool for XML documents. It offeres a web-based environment and can generate word clouds, highlight parts of text such as words, non-words and punctuation, KWIC (keyword in context) and more. TokenX also offers more playful options, such as word substitution, or an option to replace words with images.
tools.name: TokenX

tools.detail: WEAVE (Web-based Analysis and Visualization Environment) is a web-based visualization platform offered by the Institute for Visualization and Perception Research at the University of Massachusetts Lowell. It is designed to visualize any data for any purpose, and to accommodate novice and advanced users alike. It includes the ability to integrate, disseminate and visualize data at nested levels of geography. WEAVE is currently in beta. Both a web-based demo and a download version are available.
tools.name: WEAVE (Web-based Analysis and Visualization Environment)

tools.detail: Apache Xalan is a free XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text or other XML document types, offered by the Apache Software Foundation. This tool uses the Xerces XML parser to converty XML into internal nodesets, and is offered as both C++ and Java implementations.
tools.name: Apache Xalan

tools.detail: XSugar is a tool designed to manage dual syntaxes when working with XML documents, developed by the Department of Computer Science, Aarhus University. From a user-provided specification, XSugar translates between XML syntaxs, and makes statistical checks to ensure transformations will be reliably bidirectional and contain valid syntax in accordance with the schema.
tools.name: XSugar

tools.detail: Yutzu is a collaborative tool for collecting and publishing multimedia content online, offered by the Cultureplex Lab at the University of Western Ontario. It is a web environment, designed to assist in the creative process, publication and visualization, and integrating a variety of multimedia tools. Yutzu has been used to showcase work, curate exhibitions and collections, and to facilitate teaching and learning.
tools.name: Yutzu

tools.detail: ATLAS.ti is a tool for systematic qualitative data analysis released under a for-pay license. It offers multi-window frames, overviews generated through interactive network views utilizing visual interconnections, and cloud views and reports. A free demo version is also availalble, and does not include a time limit. This tool was first developed in 1989 and has been in continous development since. The web edition has been available since 2002.
tools.name: ATLAS.ti

tools.detail: CollateX is a free Java library for collating texts offered by Interedition, designed to be the successor to Peter Robinson's Collate. It uses a component-oriented architecture, to enable users to mix and match components according to their needs. Though its core library is Java, it also integrates a demo web application, a demo client application and Python language bindings that allow CollateX to be embedded into Python applications.
tools.name: CollateX

tools.detail: cue.language is a free library of Java code and resources for basic natural language processing emerging from the development of the Wordle word cloud tool and maintained by Jonathan Feinman of IBM's CUE Research Group. Its functions include tokenization, counting strings, detecting the script alphabet or writing system required to represent the text, guess the text's language and customizeable stop word detection.
tools.name: cue.language

tools.detail: CulturalAnalytics, also known as Cultural Analytics for the Digital Humanities in R, is a free R package of functions for statistical analysis and plotting image properties, developed by Rob Myers specifically for the Digital Humanities, and of value to anyone else with an interest in examining digital or digitized images. It includes statistical functions and can generate histograms, colour clouds, image scatter charts and more.
tools.name: CulturalAnalytics

tools.detail: Diction is a text analysis program for purchase, designed to determine the tone of a text, and generate reports and statistical analysis from it. DICTION versions are available for Windows® on a PC and Mac®.
tools.name: Diction

tools.detail: DiscoverText is a cloud-based textual analytics tool available for purchase. It is designed to collect data from sources such as social media, blogs and a variety of document formats, and generate tag clouds and reports from the resulting corpus.
tools.name: DiscoverText

tools.detail: Improvise is a free Java software architecture and user interface designed to enable the construction and browsing of interactive visualizations, integrating a declarative visual query language.
tools.name: Improvise

tools.detail: Pressbooks is a platform for collaboratively creating ebooks built over WordPress available as both a free service and on a subscription basis. Subscriptions are only required for users wanting to manage more than 5 books. eBooks can be generated in a variety of formats from several provided templates. Pressbooks integrates functionality for importing material from WordPress, Blogger and Tumblr, and assists in collaborative authoring with workflow management tools.
tools.name: Pressbooks

tools.detail: Tesseract is a free raw OCR engine originally developed by HP Labs and now maintained by Google. It works with the Leptonica Image Processing Library, and is capable of reading a variety of image formats. It can convert images to text in over 40 languages.
tools.name: Tesseract OCR

tools.detail: Timeline JS is a free timeline tool that can be poplulated from either a Google spreadsheet or a JSON file, and can draw media material from a variety of sources, such as Twitter, Flickr, Wikipedia, YouTube and more. It has been designed to be both easy to use and easy to embed the results in another web page.
tools.name: Timeline JS

tools.detail: TXM is a free, open source text corpus analysis environment. Its features include concordance, collocate search, frequencies based on the CQP full text search engine and statistical functions based on R packages. It can export results in CSV, XML or SVG format, and runs as a standalone desktop application in Windows, OS X and Linux environments, or as a web portal (download the leaflet for more).
tools.name: TXM

tools.detail: VARD 2 is a free, creative commons tool for preprocessing historical corpora. Built in Java, it enables researchers to easily match up historic variant spellings with modern conventions. Though optimized for Early Modern English, other languages can be accomodated with user-supplied variant word lists.
tools.name: VARD 2

tools.detail: Wmatrix is a free tool for corpus analysis and comparison. It provides a web interface for USAS and CLAWS, in addition to enabling standard corpus linguistic functions such as frequency lists and concordances.
tools.name: Wmatrix
